Key Match Events: Brandon Nimmo hit a tiebreaking single in a three-run seventh inning
Francisco Alvarez and Luisangel Acuña hit second-inning home runs
Francisco Alvarez added a two-run double in the seventh inning for a 5-2 lead
Edwin Díaz got a four-out save
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets remained two games ahead of Atlanta for the final NL wild card
The Mets improved to 5-1 on their seven-game homestand minus star shortstop Francisco Lindor (sore back)
The Phillies can secure their first NL East title since 2011 with a victory over the Mets on Sunday night
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Carlos Mendoza said, "Yeah, we lost a guy that is in the MVP conversation, but hey, we’ve got to keep going"
Nimmo said, "It felt unbelievable today, it was high energy. Every pitch mattered and the crowd was in it the whole time."
Miscellaneous Highlights: A crowd of 44,152 filled Citi Field, just the fourth sellout this season
The Mets finished 5-5 this season in their new gray City Connect jerseys
RHP Kodai Senga pitched a hitless inning with a walk and two strikeouts for Triple-A Syracuse in his first rehab outing since straining his left calf in his season debut on July 26
Others: RHP Spencer Turnbull (strained right lat) is slated for a rehab outing with the IronPigs in their season finale Sunday
RHP Paul Blackburn (spinal fluid leak in back) won’t pitch during the rest of the regular season, Mendoza said
